step1.sentence: The launch date for the new product is still up in the air because the engineering team needs more time to fix critical bugs.

step2.story: Maya had been hoping for a promotion, but after her manager left the company, everything was up in the air. She updated her portfolio anyway and kept doing her best work each day.

step3.story: The merger between the two firms had been announced six months ago, but the final terms were still up in the air. Employees gathered in the break room each morning, trading rumors and half-heard conversations from closed-door meetings. Daniel had already received two job offers from competitors, yet he hesitated to accept either one, hoping clarity would arrive soon. His wife reminded him that waiting for perfect certainty was itself a choice. On Friday afternoon, an all-hands email finally landed in his inbox — but it only said that a decision would be shared 'in the coming weeks.' He closed his laptop, grabbed his coat, and decided the uncertainty would have to wait until Monday.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 공중에 떠 있다는 뜻으로, 무언가가 아직 결정되지 않고 허공에 떠 있는 상태를 묘사합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 계획이나 결정이 아직 확정되지 않아 결과를 알 수 없는 상황에서 사용합니다. 직장, 계약, 일정 등 어떤 분야에서도 널리 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 항공기나 풍선처럼 공중에 떠 있는 이미지에서 유래했으며, 땅에 닿지 않은 것처럼 확정되지 않은 상태를 비유적으로 표현합니다. 19세기 중반부터 영어 관용구로 굳어졌습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 중립적인 표현이지만 불확실성으로 인한 불안감이 내포될 수 있습니다. 격식체와 비격식체 모두에서 자연스럽게 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Our travel plans are still up in the air since we haven't booked the flights yet.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 아직 항공편을 예약하지 않아서 여행 계획이 미정인 상태예요.
